channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Loose paving slabs which are dangerous, 11th June
item.description:
Over the past 18 months the paving slabs have become more and more loose creating a sizeable gap in between them. At night time it’s extremely dangerous to be walking on and daytime is also, I have seen multiple small children catch their footing and scooters in this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Zura Avenue, Upton St. Leonards, Stroud
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Large and increasingly deep pothole, 10th June
item.description:
It's on an inside bend of the road not giving drivers much time to steer around it so it is potentially dangerous. Recent hot weather seems to have made it bigger. Please can you take a look?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Long Mynd Avenue, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Overgrown tree being used antisocially, 9th June

item.title: Nasty potholes at both traffic calming cushions on Greyhound Gardens, 9th June
item.description:
Both traffic calming cushions have potholes. Repeated repairs don't last long due to the volume of traffic forced to used one side of the road. Please do something more permanent to fix this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greyhound Gardens, Elmbridge, Gloucester

item.title: Failed road surface; multiple large potholes, 8th June
item.description:
The majority of the top-layer of the road surface has failed on Prestbury Road turning onto Whaddon Road. The failed surface extends by more than 10yds from the bus stop to the end of the turning. It's been this way for at least 6 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62, Prestbury Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven road surface southbound, 7th June
item.description:
Middle lane has severe uneven road surface southbound on approach to jnc 1. Going over this causes irregular movement in steering and could cause an accident if drivers try to avoid
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
